value:
M.Tech-Computer Science & Engineering
2 years
(4 Semesters)
12
AICTE

UPCET Counseling Direct Admission Year 1 Eligibility For Admission Through Upcet Counselling For admission to the first year of B. Tech: The candidate must have passed the intermediate examination of U.P. Board or 10+2 level examination from any recognized board/university; Securing minimum 45% (40% for SC/ST) marks in total of required subject combination (two compulsory & one optional subject). This admission test is open only for candidates who have passed the qualifying examination from any institution located in U.P and the parents, father/mother of the students must be domiciles of U.P. For admission to the first year of B. Tech: The candidate must have passed three years of Diploma in Engineering course securing a minimum 60% marks in aggregate and minimum 40% (35% for SC / ST) marks in mathematics. The admission of NRI and Kashmiri migrants will be according to the norms laid down by the Govt of UP/AICTE Year 2 Eligibility For Admission Through Upcet Counselling For admission to the first year of B. Tech: The candidate must have passed the intermediate examination of U.P. Board or 10+2 level examination from any recognized board/university; Securing minimum 45% (40% for SC/ST) marks in total of required subject combination (two compulsory & one optional subject). This admission test is open only for candidates who have passed the qualifying examination from any institution located in U.P and the parents, father/mother of the students must be domiciles of U.P. For admission to the first year of B. Tech: The candidate must have passed three years of Diploma in Engineering course securing a minimum 60% marks in aggregate and minimum 40% (35% for SC / ST) marks in mathematics. The admission of NRI and Kashmiri migrants will be according to the norms laid down by the Govt of UP/AICTE

Fee M.Tech Tuition Fee 81,500 External Exam Fee 10000 Internal Exam Fee 4,000 Security (Refundable)(One Time) 5,000 Registration Fee Including (Lms/E-Content)(One Time) 4,400 Student Welfare (One Time) 5,000 Usage Charges 18850 Other Fee 1,750 Total First Year Fee 130,500 From Next Year Onwards 116,100 #University Pre- Registration has to be paid/done by Student

Training & workshops Training and workshops bridge the gap between theory and practice. These activities help students acquire key skills, problem-solving abilities, and inventive thinking. Students participating in them can interact, share ideas, and network with industry experts, while improving their employability.

All Branches M.Tech (Integrated) in CSE SEMESTER-I SEMESTER-II Tuition Fee 118,400 95,900 118,400 59000 59000 External Exam Fee 7,500 7,500 7,500 7,500 - Internal Exam Fee 4,000 4,000 4,000 4,000 - Security (Refundable)(One Time) 5,000 5,000 5,000 5,000 - Registration Fee Including (Lms/E-Content)(One Time) 4,750 4,750 4,750 4,750 - Student Welfare (One Time) 5,000 5,000 5,000 5,000 - Tbl (One Time) 9,100 6,400 9,100 9,100 - Department Society & Outresearch Activity 7,600 5,350 7,600 7,600 - Career Planning & Technical Grooming 7,850 5,400 7,850 7,850 - Institute Industry Interface 5,400 3,800 5,400 5,400 - Total First Year Fee 174,600 143,100 174,600 115200 59400 Total First Year Fee (One- Time Payment @ 5% Off) 165,700 135,900 165,700 - - From Next Year Onwards 150,750 121,950 150,750 91,350 59400 From Next Year Onwards (One- Time Payment @ 5% Off) 143,100 115,200 143,100 - - #University Pre- Registration has to be paid/done by Student

Tech: The candidate must have passed three years of Diploma in Engineering course securing a minimum 60% marks in aggregate and minimum 40% (35% for SC / ST) marks in mathematics. The admission of NRI and Kashmiri migrants will be according to the norms laid down by the Govt of UP/AICTE Year 2 Eligibility For Admission Through Upcet Counselling For admission to the first year of B. Tech: The candidate must have passed the intermediate examination of U.P. Board or 10+2 level examination from any recognized board/university; Securing minimum 45% (40% for SC/ST) marks in total of required subject combination (two compulsory & one optional subject).
